hints.content:
###Strategy

We can find the volume of the material used in the cracker by finding the volume of the entire snack as if there wasn't a hole, and then subtracting the volume of the hole.

$\blueE{\text{volume}_{\text{material}}} = \maroonD{\text{volume}_{\text{entire}}} - \goldE{\text{volume}_{\text{hole}}}$

###Entire volume

The entire snack is a cylinder with a diameter of $16\text{ mm}$, so its radius is $8\text{ mm}$. Its length (or height) is $18\text{ mm}$.

$\begin{align}
\text{volume}_{\text{cylinder}} &= (\text{base area}) (\text{height}) \\\\
\text{volume}_{\text{cylinder}} &= (\pi r^2) (h) \\\\
\maroonD{\text{volume}_{\text{entire}}}  &= (\pi \cdot 8^2) (18) \\\\
\maroonD{\text{volume}_{\text{entire}}}  &=  \maroonD{1{,}152\pi}
\end{align}$

The entire snack has a volume of $\maroonD{1{,}152\pi \text{ mm}^3}$ (let's not round this until the end).

###Volume of hole

The hole is a cylinder with a diameter of $8\text{ mm}$, so its radius is $4\text{ mm}$. Its length (or height) is $18\text{ mm}$.

$\begin{align}
\text{volume}_{\text{cylinder}} &= (\text{base area}) (\text{height}) \\\\
\text{volume}_{\text{cylinder}} &= (\pi r^2) (h) \\\\
\goldE{\text{volume}_{\text{hole}}}  &= (\pi \cdot 4^2) (18) \\\\
\goldE{\text{volume}_{\text{hole}}}  &=  \goldE{288\pi} 
\end{align}$

The hole has a volume of $\goldE{288\pi \text{ mm}^3}$ (let's not round this until the end).
The volume of the material used in each cracker is about $\blueE{2714\text{ mm}^3}$.

question.content:
A company makes cylindrical crackers that have a cylindrical hole in the middle. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5705bd80c2829cfcb1f5750cb5e862faee28dd2a)

The diameter of the entire cracker is $16\text{ mm}$, the diameter of the hole is $8\text{ mm}$, and the cracker is $18\text{ mm}$ long.

**What is the volume of the material used in each cracker?**  
*Round to the nearest cubic millimeter.*

[[☃ numeric-input 1]] $\text{mm}^3$
